bioghist.p: The Hayes family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Elizabeth Hayes to George Smith. The founders of the Hayes family were Richard Sr. (1697) and his son Richard Jr. (1738). Richard Hayes, Jr., married Elizabeth Lewis in 1697. Their son Benjamin (1710-1764) married Mary Jones in 1737, and they had a daughter Elizabeth (1738-1767). Elizabeth Hayes married George Smith (1732-1787) in 1764. George and Elizabeth Smith were the great-grandparents of Lawrence M.C. Smith, husband of Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to various Hayes family members. Materials include: correspondence, slides, and prints related to the Hayes family estate; wills of Mary Hayes (1825) and Richard Hayes (1697); deeds (1657, 1697); land records; and quit rent receipts (1696-1713).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
